item.title: Null Spaces and Ranges
item.description:
Null Spaces and Ranges

Exercise 1

Give an example of a linear map \( T \) such that \(\dim \text{null} \, T = 3\) and \(\dim \text{range} \, T = 2\).

Exercise 2

Suppose \( V \) is a vector space and \( S, T \in \mathcal{L}(V, V) \) are such that

\[\text{range} \, S \subset \text{null} \, T.\]


Prove that \((ST)^2 = 0\).

item.title: Vector Space of Linear Maps
item.description:
Vector Space of Linear Maps

Exercise 1

Suppose \( b, c \in \mathbb{R} \). Define \( T: \mathbb{R}^3 \to \mathbb{R}^2 \) by

\[T(x, y, z) = (2x - 4y + 3z + b, 6x + cxyz).\]


Show that \( T \) is linear if and only if \( b = c = 0 \).
